Thomas Dagget.Action: Smiles and greets police officers and Sergeant Burrows with friendly small talk.
Acknowledges cheerful comment and apologizes for it, indicating awareness and effort to improve social interaction.
Engages professionally and attentively in the investigation by asking questions about the injured person and circumstances.
Makes sarcastic remarks about the trashed flophouse and the 'suicide' rubber stamp, showing cynicism rather than warmth.
Engages professionally with Burrows on the investigation, showing no overt friendliness or goodwill beyond duty.
Lights an offering candle and kneels for a brief, silent prayer, showing a moment of personal reflection and sincerity.
Looks out the window with only medium enthusiasm in the morning, indicating a somewhat detached or indifferent attitude.
Half-heartedly tries to make sense of piled files, showing a lack of strong engagement but no negativity toward others.
Responds to his boss politely and with a smile when interrupted by a phone call, demonstrating ordinary cordiality.
Asks the coroner to withhold circulation of the file to have time to process the information before questions start.
Engages in light banter with the coroner about breaking rules.
Handles the ancient bible with care and takes time to translate it alone.
Recognizes that there is no fourteenth chapter to the Book of Revelations, displaying knowledge about the Bible.
Calmly requests the coroner to withhold circulation of the file to buy time before questions arise.
Takes the time to carefully translate the unusual fourteenth chapter from Latin on his own, showing diligence and skill.
Engages in somewhat sarcastic banter with the coroner, but maintains focus on the case.
Plays racquetball intensely, shows physical effort and teamwork by covering a teammate and yelling encouragement.
Misses a ball and sarcastically responds 'Thanks a lot.'
Plays with honor, refuses to betray teammates despite encouragement to do so, ultimately double-crosses Player #2 unexpectedly.
Recites and references an obscure or special bonus chapter related to St. John's Revelations, showing interest in esoteric knowledge.
Asks insightful questions about the meaning of the scripture and possible authorship, demonstrating curiosity and deeper thinking.
Does not immediately dismiss the idea of an alternative biblical interpretation or extra chapter, indicating open-mindedness and analytical thinking.
Walks Bill to his car, engages in friendly conversation, and shows willingness to share personal history later.
Jokes casually with the coroner about the basketball game and childhood memories despite the grim scene.
Jams his hands in his pockets and leans against the autopsy table silently observing the scene.
Expresses doubt initially about being interested in the coroner's call but remains engaged and determined to solve the case.
Questions the coroner attentively and shows awareness of the situation's gravity.
Pulls out his notebook to take notes, indicating preparedness and methodical approach.
Leans against the table and makes a casual analogy about snow angels when observing the crime scene.
Doubts the importance of what the coroner wants to show him initially, saying 'I doubt it.'
Sits hunched over notes, carefully reviewing investigation details and identifies key clues such as the obituary and footprint; expresses intention to follow up in Arizona to find answers.
Responds with dry humor and candid admissions about difficulty getting straight answers, showing self-awareness and patience.
Responds to a very early call from his brother Jan with patience and warmth, expresses love and reassurance despite uncertainty.
Acknowledges the bond and concern from his brother Jan, shows empathy by acknowledging the shared family loss.
Sitting calmly in his car checking a map as a huge semi roars past
Politely informs the local sheriff of his investigative lead and offers cooperation, showing respect and awareness of local authority.
Methodically reviews watch reports for relevant information, demonstrating thoroughness and attention to detail.

Investigates the grave site, asks insightful questions about recent disturbances.
Examines the stain on the floor carefully, compares it to known evidence (burned body at morgue).
Identifies himself clearly when approaching Katherine and attempts to question her despite her reluctance.
Persists by tagging along with Katherine and accepting tasks to stay involved.
Sifts through clippings on General Hawthrone, indicating interest in tactical knowledge and history.
Sits quietly in church, seemingly contemplative and alert to unusual sensations, showing situational awareness.
Engages in calm, confident dialogue with Gabriel showing no sign of intimidation.
Shakes hands with John the Navaho bus driver and engages in friendly, polite conversation despite cultural differences.
Politely declines Katherine's offer to play bingo using her card, showing respectful but reserved interaction.
Thanks Katherine for the lift and arranges to meet again.
Engages in friendly banter with Katherine, showing a sense of humor.
Describes himself as evasive and cryptic, revealing guardedness.
Tries to comfort Katherine by explaining the situation, showing a shared understanding of suffering.
Mocks theological conflicts by calling them 'God's morons' and laughs hopelessly, expressing frustration but also a candid sincerity.

Notices Gabriel's rambler parked behind the trailer, quickly pulls out his pistol, runs for the closed door and kicks it in.

Speaks softly to an elderly villager, showing respect for the ceremony and patience.
Hands Katherine a pistol with one round, instructing her to shoot if needed, demonstrating protective concern for others' safety.
Engages in tense but cooperative interaction with Katherine, acknowledging unspoken emotions and supporting her quietly.
Locks the kiva door and secures the entrance with a heavy chain, acting to protect the villagers and ceremony, showing trustworthy and responsible behavior.
Speaks softly to an elder to try to expedite a ritual, showing understanding of limits.
Commands Katherine to stay inside and gives her a pistol with only one round, issuing clear, concise instructions.

Engages in sincere, somewhat somber conversation with Katherine about their situation and mortality.
Looks down at glass in the carpet, notices it's on the inside, picks up sunglasses thoughtfully and looks out window.

Responds honestly about his frequent frustrations, engages in light banter with Lt. Paul.
Closes his notebook slowly, somewhat guarded during questioning.

Responds calmly and reassuringly to a late-night worried call, demonstrating emotional control and a sense of responsibility.

Pulls Katherine out of dangerous situation immediately after breaking the lamp.

Uses sarcasm and hopeless laughter to cope with the absurdity of the situation, showing emotional struggle but maintaining a grasp on reality.

Leaps from crouch and hits Gabriel with a body-block, showing willingness to fight back.

Quietly endures pain and remains thoughtful rather than complaining or acting out.

Does not display any impulsive behavior or panic despite difficult circumstances; calmly proceeds to assess surroundings, including entering the church.
